page.title: 18Marshall Farmer
page.content: Marshall Farmer is a{skin and hide merchants. They collect hides all over the South-East every day from abattoirs. Altogether they collect {25,000 sheep skins}a week and 1500 hides from cattle. The hides are salted and graded, because it kills bacteria. The skins go to other companies to be turned into leather {coats and shoes. } Most shoe leather comes from sheep, because ox leather cost 5 times more than sheep. Ox hides are used for{furnishing and {leather soles. } Wool from skins is removed at fellmongers with a chemical process. The nearest competitor is probably in North London. Skins are exported to{Spain and Italy,}both of whom prefer the skin with the wool already removed. Sheepskin dusters and rugs are exported to{Germany. The factory has a very strong smell.
